trans-unit.source: Install .NET on a Cloud Service Role
trans-unit.target: Install .NET on a Cloud Service Role

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to manually install .NET framework on Cloud Service Web and Worker Roles
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to manually install .NET framework on Cloud Service Web and Worker Roles

trans-unit.source: Install .NET on a Cloud Service Role
trans-unit.target: Install .NET on a Cloud Service Role

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to install .NET framework on Cloud Service Web and Worker Roles.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to install .NET framework on Cloud Service Web and Worker Roles.

trans-unit.source: You can use these steps to install .NET framework 4.5.2 or .NET 4.6 on the Azure Guest OS Family 4.
trans-unit.target: You can use these steps to install .NET framework 4.5.2 or .NET 4.6 on the Azure Guest OS Family 4.

trans-unit.source: For the latest information on Guest OS releases see [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).
trans-unit.target: For the latest information on Guest OS releases see [Azure Guest OS Releases and SDK Compatibility Matrix](cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix.md).

trans-unit.source: The process of installing .NET on your web and worker roles involves including the .NET installer package as part of your Cloud Project and launching the installer as part of the role's startup tasks.
trans-unit.target: The process of installing .NET on your web and worker roles involves including the .NET installer package as part of your Cloud Project and launching the installer as part of the role's startup tasks.

trans-unit.source: Add the .NET installer to your project
trans-unit.target: Add the .NET installer to your project

trans-unit.source: Download the the web installer for the .NET framework you want to install
trans-unit.target: Download the the web installer for the .NET framework you want to install

trans-unit.source: .NET 4.5.2 Web Installer
trans-unit.target: .NET 4.5.2 Web Installer

trans-unit.source: .NET 4.6 Web Installer
trans-unit.target: .NET 4.6 Web Installer

trans-unit.source: For a Web Role
trans-unit.target: For a Web Role

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, under In **Roles** in the cloud service project right click on your role and select **Add>New Folder**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, under In **Roles** in the cloud service project right click on your role and select **Add>New Folder**.

trans-unit.source: Create a folder named *bin*
trans-unit.target: Create a folder named *bin*

trans-unit.source: Right click on the **bin** folder and select **Add>Existing Item**.
trans-unit.target: Right click on the **bin** folder and select **Add>Existing Item**.

trans-unit.source: Select the .NET installer and add it to the bin folder.
trans-unit.target: Select the .NET installer and add it to the bin folder.

trans-unit.source: For a Worker Role
trans-unit.target: For a Worker Role

trans-unit.source: Right click on your role and select **Add>Existing Item**.
trans-unit.target: Right click on your role and select **Add>Existing Item**.

trans-unit.source: Select the .NET installer and add it to the role.
trans-unit.target: Select the .NET installer and add it to the role.

trans-unit.source: Files added this way to the Role Content Folder will automatically be added to the cloud service package and deployed to a consistent location on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Files added this way to the Role Content Folder will automatically be added to the cloud service package and deployed to a consistent location on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this process for all web and worker roles in your Cloud Service so all roles have a copy of the installer.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this process for all web and worker roles in your Cloud Service so all roles have a copy of the installer.

trans-unit.source: ![Role Contents with installer files][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Role Contents with installer files][1]

trans-unit.source: Define startup tasks for your roles
trans-unit.target: Define startup tasks for your roles

trans-unit.source: Startup tasks allow you to perform operations before a role starts.
trans-unit.target: Startup tasks allow you to perform operations before a role starts.

trans-unit.source: Installing the .NET Framework as part of the startup task will ensure that the framework is installed before any of your application code is run.
trans-unit.target: Installing the .NET Framework as part of the startup task will ensure that the framework is installed before any of your application code is run.

trans-unit.source: For more information on startup tasks see: [Run Startup Tasks in Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh180155.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information on startup tasks see: [Run Startup Tasks in Azure](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh180155.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Add the following to the *ServiceDefinition.csdef* file under the **WebRole** or **WorkerRole** node for all roles:
trans-unit.target: Add the following to the *ServiceDefinition.csdef* file under the **WebRole** or **WorkerRole** node for all roles:

trans-unit.source: The above configuration will run the console command *install.cmd* with administrator privileges so it can install the .NET framework.
trans-unit.target: The above configuration will run the console command *install.cmd* with administrator privileges so it can install the .NET framework.

trans-unit.source: The configuration also creates a LocalStorage with the name *InstallLogs* to store any log information created by the install script.
trans-unit.target: The configuration also creates a LocalStorage with the name *InstallLogs* to store any log information created by the install script.

trans-unit.source: For more see: [Use local storage to store files during startup](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh974419.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more see: [Use local storage to store files during startup](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh974419.aspx)

trans-unit.source: Create a file **install.cmd** and add it to all roles by right click on the role and selecting **Add>Existing Item...**.
trans-unit.target: Create a file **install.cmd** and add it to all roles by right click on the role and selecting **Add>Existing Item...**.

trans-unit.source: So all roles should now have the .NET installer file as well as the install.cmd file.
trans-unit.target: So all roles should now have the .NET installer file as well as the install.cmd file.

trans-unit.source: ![Role Contents with all files][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Role Contents with all files][2]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Use a simple text editor like notepad to create this file.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Use a simple text editor like notepad to create this file.

trans-unit.source: If you use Visual Studio to create a text file and then rename it to '.cmd' the file may still contain a UTF-8 Byte Order Mark and running the first line of the script will result in an error.
trans-unit.target: If you use Visual Studio to create a text file and then rename it to '.cmd' the file may still contain a UTF-8 Byte Order Mark and running the first line of the script will result in an error.

trans-unit.source: If you were to use Visual Studio to create the file leave add a REM (Remark) to the first line of the file so that it is ignored when run.
trans-unit.target: If you were to use Visual Studio to create the file leave add a REM (Remark) to the first line of the file so that it is ignored when run.

trans-unit.source: Add the following script to the **install.cmd** file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following script to the **install.cmd** file:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Update the value of the *netfx* variable in the script to match the framework version you want to install.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Update the value of the *netfx* variable in the script to match the framework version you want to install.

trans-unit.source: To install .NET 4.5.2 the *netfx* variable should be set to *"NDP452"* and to install .NET 4.6 the *netfx* variable should be set to *"NDP46"*
trans-unit.target: To install .NET 4.5.2 the *netfx* variable should be set to *"NDP452"* and to install .NET 4.6 the *netfx* variable should be set to *"NDP46"*

trans-unit.source: The install script checks whether the specified .NET framework version is already installed on the machine by querying the registry.
trans-unit.target: The install script checks whether the specified .NET framework version is already installed on the machine by querying the registry.

trans-unit.source: If the .NET version is not installed then the .Net Web Installer is launched.
trans-unit.target: If the .NET version is not installed then the .Net Web Installer is launched.

trans-unit.source: To help troubleshoot with any issues the script will log all activity to a file named *startuptasklog-(currentdatetime).txt* stored in *InstallLogs* local storage.
trans-unit.target: To help troubleshoot with any issues the script will log all activity to a file named *startuptasklog-(currentdatetime).txt* stored in *InstallLogs* local storage.

trans-unit.source: Configure diagnostics to transfer the startup task logs to blob storage (Optional)
trans-unit.target: Configure diagnostics to transfer the startup task logs to blob storage (Optional)

trans-unit.source: You can optionally configure Azure Diagnostics to transfer any log files generated by the startup script or the .NET installer to blob storage.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally configure Azure Diagnostics to transfer any log files generated by the startup script or the .NET installer to blob storage.

trans-unit.source: With this approach you can view the logs by simply downloading the log files from blob storage rather than having to remote desktop into the role.
trans-unit.target: With this approach you can view the logs by simply downloading the log files from blob storage rather than having to remote desktop into the role.

trans-unit.source: To configure diagnostics open the *diagnostics.wadcfgx* and add the following under the **Directories** node:
trans-unit.target: To configure diagnostics open the *diagnostics.wadcfgx* and add the following under the **Directories** node:

trans-unit.source: This will configure azure diagnostics to transfer all files in the *InstallLogs* resource to the diagnostics storage account in the *netfx-install* blob container.
trans-unit.target: This will configure azure diagnostics to transfer all files in the *InstallLogs* resource to the diagnostics storage account in the *netfx-install* blob container.

trans-unit.source: Deploying your service
trans-unit.target: Deploying your service

trans-unit.source: When you deploy your service the startup tasks will run and install the .NET framework if it is not already installed.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy your service the startup tasks will run and install the .NET framework if it is not already installed.

trans-unit.source: Your roles will be in the busy state while the framework is installing and may even restart if the framework install requires it.
trans-unit.target: Your roles will be in the busy state while the framework is installing and may even restart if the framework install requires it.

trans-unit.source: Additional Resources
trans-unit.target: Additional Resources

trans-unit.target: Installing the .NET Framework

trans-unit.target: How to: Determine Which .NET Framework Versions Are Installed

trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting .NET Framework Installations

trans-unit.target: test
